poem:
"Persuasions in Scarlet and Indigo"

In the interchange of words,
the value of the wheat field,
the mother, vested in fret, finds
no solace only a well-considered fear.
Daughter, of stern stock,
defines a trajectory towards the
anointed path of knowledge,
A distant university beckons. 
She whispers not of rebellion, 
but of strength, in inked tongues.
The crimson sun rises; her safety in wisdom blooms.
